inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of sickle cell disease (electrophoretic or HPLC documentation of hemoglobin S only phenotype is required)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No vaso-occlusive crisis during the previous two weeks
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: physical exam: afebrile within normal blood pressure, no splenomegaly detected

inclusion.criterion: Can speak and understand English to complete assessments and scales
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Inability to provide his/her own informed consent
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Drug or alcohol dependence/abuse within the past 5 years
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Cigarette smoking or the use of any tobacco products within two years
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient: He won't smoke or uses any illicit drugs

exclusion.criterion: Use of tranquilizers, steroids, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agents three or more times per week
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of sickle cell crises since childhood and had severe pain in his lower back that radiated to both thighs scored 9 out of 10. He was treated with oxycodone which was not beneficial to his pain.
